name: Webnative
comment:
Interface for [webnative](https://github.com/fission-codes/webnative#readme), version `0.24` and up.

1.  [Getting Started](#getting-started)
2.  [Ports](#ports)
3.  [Authorisation](#authorisation)
4.  [Authentication](#authentication)
5.  [Filesystem](#filesystem)
6.  [Miscellaneous](#miscellaneous)


# Getting Started

@docs init, initWithOptions, InitOptions, defaultInitOptions, initialise, initialize


# Ports

Data flowing through the ports. See `ðŸš€` in the `decodeResponse` example on how to handle the result from `init`.

@docs decodeResponse, DecodedResponse, Artifact, NoArtifact, Request, Response, Error, error, context


# Authorisation

@docs redirectToLobby, RedirectTo, AppPermissions, FileSystemPermissions, BranchFileSystemPermissions, Permissions


# Authentication

@docs isAuthenticated, leave, signOut, State, AuthSucceededState, AuthCancelledState, ContinuationState


# Filesystem

@docs loadFileSystem

unions.name: Artifact
unions.comment: Artifact we receive in the response.

unions.name: NoArtifact
unions.comment:
Not really artifacts, but kind of.
Part of the `Artifact` type.

unions.name: RedirectTo
unions.comment: Where the authorisation lobby should redirect to after authorisation.

aliases.name: AuthCancelledState
aliases.comment: State attributes when auth was cancelled.

aliases.name: AuthSucceededState
aliases.comment: State attributes when auth has succeeded.
aliases.type: { newUser : Basics.Bool, throughLobby : Basics.Bool, username : String.String }

aliases.name: BranchFileSystemPermissions
aliases.comment:
Filesystem permissions for a branch.

This is reused for the private and public permissions.
aliases.type: { directories : List.List (Webnative.Path.Path Webnative.Path.Directory), files : List.List (Webnative.Path.Path Webnative.Path.File) }

aliases.name: ContinuationState
aliases.comment: State attributes when continueing a session.
aliases.type: { newUser : Basics.Bool, throughLobby : Basics.Bool, username : String.String }

aliases.name: FileSystemPermissions
aliases.comment:
Filesystem permissions.

    ```elm
    import Webnative.Path as Path

    { private =
        { directories = [ Path.directory [ "Audio", "Mixtapes" ] ]
        , files = [ Path.file [ "Audio", "Playlists", "Jazz.json" ] ]
        }
    , public =
        { directories = []
        , files = []
        }
    }
    ```

aliases.name: InitOptions
aliases.comment:
Options for `initWithOptions`.

Setting `autoRemoveUrlParams` to `True` causes webnative to automatically remove the query parameters from the lobby.

Setting `loadFileSystem` to `False` disables the automatic loading of the filesystem during `init`.

aliases.name: Permissions
aliases.comment:
Permissions to ask the user.
See [`AppPermissions`](#AppPermissions) and [`FileSystemPermissions`](#FileSystemPermissions) on how to use these.
aliases.type: { app : Maybe.Maybe Webnative.AppPermissions, fs : Maybe.Maybe Webnative.FileSystemPermissions }

aliases.name: Request
aliases.type: { context : String.String, tag : String.String, method : String.String, arguments : List.List Json.Encode.Value }

aliases.name: Response
aliases.type: { context : String.String, error : Maybe.Maybe String.String, tag : String.String, method : String.String, data : Json.Encode.Value }

values.name: decodeResponse
values.comment:
Decode the result, the `Response`, from our `Request`.
Connect this up with `webnativeResponse` subscription port.

    subscriptions =
        Ports.webnativeResponse GotWebnativeResponse

And then in `update` use this function.

    GotWebnativeResponse response ->
      case Webnative.decodeResponse tagFromString response of
        -----------------------------------------
        -- ðŸš€
        -----------------------------------------
        Webnative ( Initialisation state ) ->
          if Webnative.isAuthenticated state then
            loadUserData
          else
            welcome

        -----------------------------------------
        -- ðŸ’¾
        -----------------------------------------
        Wnfs ReadHelloTxt ( Utf8Content helloContents ) ->
          -- Do something with content from hello.txt

        Wnfs Mutation _ ->
          ( model
          , { tag = PointerUpdated }
              |> Wnfs.publish
              |> Ports.webnativeRequest
          )

        -----------------------------------------
        -- ðŸ¥µ
        -----------------------------------------
        -- Do something with the errors,
        -- here we cast them to strings
        WebnativeError err -> Webnative.error err
        WnfsError err -> Wnfs.error err

See the [README](../latest/) for the full example.
values.type: (String.String -> Result.Result String.String tag) -> Webnative.Response -> Webnative.DecodedResponse tag

values.name: init
values.comment:
ðŸš€ **Start here**

Check if we're authenticated, process any lobby query-parameters present in the URL, and initiate the user's filesystem if authenticated (can be disabled using `initWithOptions`).

See `loadFileSystem` if you want to load the user's filesystem yourself.
**NOTE**, this only works on the main/ui thread, as it uses `window.location`.

See the [README](../latest/) for an example.

values.name: leave
values.comment:
Leave the app and go the lobby.
Removes all traces of the user.
Use `signOut` instead if you don't want the redirect.

values.name: signOut
values.comment:
Removes all traces of the user.
Use `leave` instead if you want to
go to the lobby immediately so the user
can sign out there as well, if needed.

name: Webnative.Path

unions.name: Path
unions.comment:
Path type.

This is used with the [phantom ðŸ‘» types](#phantom-types).

    directoryPath : Path Directory

    filePath : Path File

    encapsulatedPath : Path Encapsulated

values.name: encode
values.comment:
Encode to JSON.

    >>> import Json.Encode

    >>> [ "foo" ]
    ..>   |> directory
    ..>   |> encode
    ..>   |> Json.Encode.encode 0
    "{\"directory\":[\"foo\"]}"

    >>> [ "bar" ]
    ..>   |> file
    ..>   |> encode
    ..>   |> Json.Encode.encode 0
    "{\"file\":[\"bar\"]}"

values.name: fromPosix
values.comment:
Convert a POSIX formatted string to a path.

This will return a `Encapsulated` path. To get a path of the type `Path Directory` or `Path File`, use the functions in the `Webnative.Path.Encapsulated` module.

    >>> import Webnative.Path.Encapsulated

    >>> "foo/bar/"
    ..>   |> fromPosix
    ..>   |> Webnative.Path.Encapsulated.toDirectory
    Just (directory [ "foo", "bar" ])

    >>> "foo/bar"
    ..>   |> fromPosix
    ..>   |> Webnative.Path.Encapsulated.toFile
    Just (file [ "foo", "bar" ])

values.name: kind
values.comment:
Get the path kind.

    >>> kind (directory [])
    Directory

    >>> kind (file [])
    File

    Even if a path is encapsulated,
    you can still check the kind of path it is.

    >>> kind (encapsulate <| directory [])
    Directory

    >>> kind (encapsulate <| file [])
    File

values.name: map
values.type: (List.List String.String -> List.List String.String) -> Webnative.Path.Path t -> Webnative.Path.Path t

values.name: toPosix
values.comment:
Convert a path to the POSIX format.

    >>> toPosix (directory [ "foo", "bar"])
    "foo/bar/"

    >>> toPosix (file [ "foo", "bar"])
    "foo/bar"

values.name: unwrap
values.comment:
Get the path parts.

    >>> unwrap (directory [ "foo", "bar" ])
    [ "foo", "bar" ]

    >>> unwrap (file [ "foo", "bar" ])
    [ "foo", "bar" ]

values.name: toDirectory
values.comment: Remove the membrane and extract a `Path Directory`.

values.name: toFile
values.comment: Remove the membrane and extract a `Path File`.

name: Wnfs

unions.name: Artifact
unions.comment: Artifact we receive in the response.

aliases.name: Entry
aliases.type: { cid : String.String, name : String.String, kind : Webnative.Path.Kind, size : Basics.Int }

values.name: mv
values.comment: Move something from one location to another.
values.type: Wnfs.Base -> { from : Webnative.Path.Path t, to : Webnative.Path.Path t, tag : String.String } -> Wnfs.Request

values.name: publish
values.comment:
Publish your changes to your filesystem.
**ðŸ“¢ You should run this after doing mutations.**
See [README](../latest/) examples for more info.

values.name: read
values.comment: Read a file from the filesystem in the form of `Bytes`.

values.name: readUtf8
values.comment: Read a file from the filesystem in the form of a `String`.

values.name: writeUtf8
values.comment: Write to a file using a `String`.
